definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: “You have to have an end state,” she said.
sentences.chinese: “你必須對結束戰亂有所作爲，”她表示。

sentences.english: The story is set in the Sengoku period.
sentences.chinese: 這是個位於戰亂的時代。

sentences.english: The demonic power that sparda once imprisoned…will be mine.
sentences.chinese: 而我將成爲這個捲入了戰亂的荒廢大陸的最後統治者。

sentences.english: Sometimes epidemic disease follows right after a war.
sentences.chinese: 有時戰亂過後，病疫會隨之而來。

sentences.english: The documents survived unmolested through centuries of war and upheaval.
sentences.chinese: 這些文件安然無恙地經過了多年的戰亂和發掘。

sentences.english: In order to survive in wars and riots, villagers often attached themselves to the large clans and thus became the obscure and dependent population.
sentences.chinese: 村民爲躲避戰亂和徭役，常投身大族，成爲隱附人口。

sentences.english: For many years war restricted China's at tendance at Wor ld Exhibitions.
sentences.chinese: 多年的戰亂使中國無緣世界博覽會。

sentences.english: However, it was destroyed by Zhang Xianzhon rebellion after the decay in Yuan Dynasty, and war chaos in Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 經元代的中衰，明代的戰亂，石室終毀於張獻忠之亂。

sentences.english: Explosive plotline set amidst a terrible civil war in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 火爆的遊戲舞臺被設定在被戰亂不斷破壞的非洲大陸。

sentences.english: It was one of seven states that had been warring for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 當時，七國爭霸，常年戰亂，秦是其中一國。

sentences.english: The establishment of the Nationalist government in 1928 was supposed tobring the period of warfare to an end.
sentences.chinese: 1928年南京國民政府的成立被認爲是戰亂的結束。

sentences.english: The most heavily polluted, and the war torn ones will be major areas of concentration.
sentences.chinese: 最嚴重的污染和飽經戰亂的地區將在首要領域中。

sentences.english: After years of war and chaos the people urgently needed rehabilitation.
sentences.chinese: 人民於連年戰亂之後，已亟待休養生息。

sentences.english: The Battle of Pharsalus ended the wars of the First Triumvirate.
sentences.chinese: 法薩羅戰役結束了第一次三頭統治時期的戰亂。

sentences.english: People in the middle of violent political chaos don't buy dishwashers.
sentences.chinese: 最簡單的例子就是，誰會在戰亂中買洗碗機呢？

sentences.english: They went there to have a nice, you know, retreat from all the hubbub of the capital city of Cuzco.
sentences.chinese: 他們去那裏逃避所有的喧譁，躲避戰亂。

definition: variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
